header.title: The Scroll of Set, Issue Number 68
header.category: Western Esotericism, Occultism, Setian Philosophy, Consciousness Studies

central_thesis: This issue of 'The Scroll of Set' explores diverse aspects of Setian philosophy and practice, demonstrating how principles like martial arts secrecy and the development of 'will consciousness' align with the 'Æon of Set' – a unique evolutionary disposition of consciousness that provides purpose and meaning, transcending earlier occult and mundane frameworks, and supported by a structured organizational system and curated educational resources.

structure_content.summary: This article discusses the personal and societal relevance of martial arts, specifically Shaolin boxing (Sil Lu Ch'uan Fa), as a means of self-defense and self-discipline against aggression. It introduces the esoteric concept of 'secrecy' within martial arts, not as concealment of techniques, but as a discipline to redirect energy (anger, boasting) and demonstrate the futility of aggression. The article posits that a widespread practice of martial arts, underpinned by secrecy, fosters a societal belief that aggression will inevitably be met with skilled resistance, thus deterring violent acts.

This article defines 'moments of being awake' as profound, high-emotional intensity experiences that lead to a complete and lasting sensory consciousness, distinct from ordinary memory. It argues that developing the ability to 'will consciousness' (to correlate the mind's own contents) is crucial for initiates in Black Magic, enabling them to synthesize philosophical, political, scientific, and creative insights for higher evolution, as guided by the 'Crystal Tablet'. This development begins with an awareness of the 'mechanical consistency of laws' – both natural and human – which are foundational for success in 'Lesser Black Magic'.

This article positions the 'Æon of Set' as the current evolutionary state of consciousness, reflected in contemporary scientific and technological advancements. It contrasts the Æon of Set with preceding Æons (Horus, Satan), which focused on individual Will and selfish gratification respectively, but ultimately led to a sense of purposelessness. The Temple of Set, according to the author, provides the 'overriding sense of the governing principle and purpose' that these external advancements lack, offering a framework to understand and navigate the 'new rules' of this Æon and justify individual existence. It acknowledges the complexity of new æonic truths and the rare quality of 'Masters of the Temple IV°' who can grasp them.

This section outlines the organizational structure of local groups within the Temple of Set, known as 'Pylons' (derived from ancient Egyptian gate architecture). Pylons serve as local 'gates' to the Temple, fostering fellowship, cooperation, and coordination among members. Leadership ('Pylon Sentinel') can be held by Priesthood members, Adepts, or senior Setians designated by the High Priest. The experience gained in Pylons is considered invaluable for those aspiring to the Priesthood. Guidelines for forming a Pylon and seeking assistance are provided.

structure_content.chapter_title: [5] Book Review: The Twilight Zone Companion
structure_content.summary: This is a review of Marc Scott Zicree's 'The Twilight Zone Companion'. The reviewer praises the book's comprehensive documentation of Rod Serling's narrations, episode synopses, and production details, but critically notes Zicree's overemphasis on plot continuity. The reviewer argues that 'The Twilight Zone' was fundamentally about exploring 'the wondrous dimension of imagination,' where consistency is secondary to the characters' realization of phenomena 'out of sync with the natural order of things'.

This brief section announces the annual revision and update of the Temple of Set's official reading list, contained within the 'Crystal Tablet of Set'. Setians are encouraged to submit recommendations for improvements and additions, particularly concerning relevant organizations and interest groups for each subject area. The goal is to curate the most useful and essential resources for Initiates.

key_concepts.definition: In the context of Shaolin boxing, it refers to the discipline of redirecting energy (e.g., anger, boasting) and applying skill minimally to demonstrate the futility of aggression. It also implies keeping one's combat capabilities unknown to an aggressor to create a deterrent effect.
The 'forbidden art of Shaolin boxing' practiced by the author for self-defense and personal development, forming the practical basis for the 'Shaolin Warrior' philosophy.

Experiences of high emotional intensity that lead to a complete, lasting sensory consciousness, deeply ingrained in the psyche, distinct from ordinary memory, where one can relive the event with total sensory recall.
The ability of the mind to consciously correlate its own contents, a critical developmental step for initiates in Black Magic to achieve higher evolution by synthesizing diverse knowledge.

The inherent laws governing nature, human behavior, and interaction. Awareness and understanding of these laws are presented as foundational for actuating consciousness and achieving success in Lesser Black Magic.

The current evolutionary state of mind or 'disposition of consciousness' that provides an 'overriding sense of governing principle and purpose' for human existence, distinct from and transcending previous æonic paradigms.
A preceding æonic period characterized by the emphasis on 'one's own true Will' and the preeminence of the individual, superseding a mass-interest ethic.

A preceding æonic period that brought the æon to 'critical mass' by focusing on selfish gratification and casting off altruism, yet inadvertently led to an awareness of the purposelessness of existence.
Local organizational groups within the Temple of Set, named after ancient Egyptian pylon gates, serving as 'gates' to the Temple for fostering fellowship, cooperation, and coordination among members.
A core curriculum or compendium of knowledge within the Temple of Set, which presents disciplines for higher evolution and contains the annually revised official reading list.

practical_system.description: The text outlines a multi-faceted system for personal and collective development within the Temple of Set framework. It includes martial arts training (e.g., Shaolin boxing) for self-defense, self-discipline, and cultivating 'secrecy' as a means of redirecting energy and deterring aggression. It also details a process for developing 'will consciousness' through self-awareness and understanding the 'mechanical consistency of laws' (natural and human), serving as a foundational step for Black Magic initiates toward higher evolution. The system involves engagement with the Temple's curricula (the 'Crystal Tablet'), participation in local 'Pylons' for fellowship and coordination, and contributing to the ongoing refinement of educational resources. The ultimate goal is to provide a 'governing principle and purpose' for individual existence within the 'Æon of Set'.
tools: Shaolin boxing (Sil Lu Ch'uan Fa) techniques
Local Pylon meetings and organizational structure
Contact with Temple Priesthood/Executive Director for guidance and resources
Study and application of specific reading list items (e.g., #19B and #19C for consciousness development)

relevant_quotes.text: The value of the martial arts was learned in my study of Sil Lu Chʼuan Fa Kung Fu about ten years ago, when a Shaolin temple was erected here in the city. That value is that of secrecy in which we learned the virtues of self-discipline and patience – the strength to “deny the dragon”, according to the teachings of my master.

Not only does punishment show that others may hurt one, it also teaches that one way in which people deal with one another is by causing injury or distress. And it teaches the value of the power to do so.
Secrecy in the martial arts has the most effect when the number of martial artists increases to where an aggressor will believe it is inevitable he will be damaged rather than his victim.

Have you ever had experiences in which, when you thought of them even years later, you found that you could smell the atmosphere, hear the background noises, see the lightning, know every move that was made, every word that was said, feel the actual experience occur again with your total psyche? These are moments of being awake, of reaching a certain degree of consciousness...

In the evolutionary development of the initiate involved with Black Magic, however, the acquiring of this type of consciousness becomes desirable and at some point necessary if one is to synthesize the seemingly-unconnected philosophical, political, scientific, and creative reasons for desiring higher evolution, as presented by the various disciplines contained within the Crystal Tablet.

The answer is that a true magical æon represents an evolutionary state of mind - a 'disposition of the consciousness', if you will - that begins to come into recognizable focus at a particular point in objective/historical time and be received with a certain tolerance and enthusiasm.

But we have something that the various specialized mushrooms of the Æon of Set do not have, and that is an overriding sense of the governing principle and purpose behind this sudden (post-1975) questing for evolutionary justification of the human life experience.

The concepts emphasized within the curricula of the Temple of Set by the Masters are those which they deem to be most attuned to a balanced personal exploration of the forces and principles operative within the Aeon.

critical_analysis.relevance: This issue is highly relevant for understanding the multifaceted nature of Setian philosophy. It seamlessly integrates practical self-development (martial arts, consciousness work) with broader metaphysical and historical narratives (the Æons). The discussion of 'secrecy' in martial arts offers an esoteric reinterpretation of a common practice, aligning it with self-discipline and strategic deterrence rather than mere concealment. The exploration of 'will consciousness' provides a technical pathway for initiates to achieve higher evolutionary states within the Black Magic paradigm, contrasting with Lovecraftian warnings against such knowledge. The Æonic framework contextualizes the Temple of Set's unique position as a guide for meaning and purpose in a world grappling with the outcomes of previous occult and mundane intellectual movements. The organizational and educational updates reinforce the practical, structured support system for Setian initiates.
critical_analysis.target_audience: Current and prospective Initiates of the Temple of Set; practitioners of Western Esotericism and Occultism interested in Setian philosophy, particularly its perspectives on consciousness, personal power, and societal engagement; martial artists seeking a philosophical/esoteric dimension to their practice; and researchers studying modern magical orders and their evolving ideologies.
